channel.title: Should I upgrade to windows 7?
channel.description:
xp currently 3.0 ghz single core 1gb ram hd 4650 ~120gb hdd Dell etc.
This is the desktop which my family uses. Is it worth upgrading to windows 7? I would be using http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5757941/Windows.7.ULTIMATE.x86.x64.Fully.Activated.August_2010-CHR Btw I do currently have an ubuntu partition which I need to remove anyway because I'm moving out and no one else would use it.

item.title: Should I upgrade to windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

1gb ram Intel Pentium 4 3.20ghz 150gb HDD Can't remember the graphics card (I'm on my laptop)

I run Windows 7 fine tbh.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade to windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:26, topic:362698”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=458979.msg3361366#msg3361366 date=1286406591]

Seven beats XP by a long shot, but if its just for your family then theres really no need. It wont make a difference in everyday tasks.

No it doesn’t. Yeah, the UI changes aren’t great, but the actual functionality is always improving. Office is one place where Microsoft always do well.

Stay with XP. There is no reason to upgrade with specs like that.

Also if you do upgrade and use that torrent have fun with your botnet.

What the fuck are you talking about. I used a torrented Windows 7 with Haz Windows 7 Activator and I was fully updated. I did this for almost a year and had no problems. Now I am on OSX but I know for sure it would still work.

[/quote]
Were you picking quotes randomly or trying to show that thug said seven wasnt better than xp?

beyond 2003 office gets worse

[quote author=Thug-life link=topic=458979.msg3360976#msg3360976 date=1286381406]
No it doesn’t. Yeah, the UI changes aren’t great, but the actual functionality is always improving. Office is one place where Microsoft always do well.
[/quote][/quote]

I was agreeing with the first two statements, then responding to cumescapes retarded comment.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade to windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:22, topic:362698”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=458979.msg3362095#msg3362095 date=1286475399]

openoffice is terrible wtf

Seriously? I love open office, I’ve never had a problem with it for more years than I remember. Office 2007 however I can’t hardly use.
[/quote]

I think your love for open source is beginning to compromise your judgement on software.[/quote]

I used open-office even back when I used windows and didn’t even know about open source software, mainly because it was free and I couldn’t afford office. I’ve never had a problem with it, though I don’t use it for anything very advanced I suppose, just to type papers and the occasional spreadsheet.

Read full topic

Seven beats XP by a long shot, but if its just for your family then theres really no need. It wont make a difference in everyday tasks.
[/quote]

No it doesn’t. Yeah, the UI changes aren’t great, but the actual functionality is always improving. Office is one place where Microsoft always do well.

Stay with XP. There is no reason to upgrade with specs like that.

Also if you do upgrade and use that torrent have fun with your botnet.

What the fuck are you talking about. I used a torrented Windows 7 with Haz Windows 7 Activator and I was fully updated. I did this for almost a year and had no problems. Now I am on OSX but I know for sure it would still work.[/quote]
Were you picking quotes randomly or trying to show that thug said seven wasnt better than xp?

beyond 2003 office gets worse

Thug-life:

No it doesn’t. Yeah, the UI changes aren’t great, but the actual functionality is always improving. Office is one place where Microsoft always do well.

item.title: Should I upgrade to windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:13, topic:362698”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=458979.msg3360948#msg3360948 date=1286375370]
I guess I won’t bother then. This brings me to another question, should I upgrade my Microsoft Office from 2003 to 2010?2003 works perfectly fine but perhaps 2010 is less resource-demanding?
[/quote]it’s actually kinda annoying to learn where each setting is with the aberrant UI and all once you’ve been used to 2003 for a long time[/quote]
Or 2000 for that matter. I remember using it loads up until not to long ago. It was really stable and fast for me.

NOT@ABRAHAM:Suppose that’s why I never bothered changing. Now I use open office. Can be a little sluggish sometimes. Although why can’t schools use open office? Driving me nutty when I forget to save it as the correct format. Also, that ruddy new .docx, now if I want to take/email something home, remember to change the format! I’ll be damned if I’m going to any later than 2003. I’ve always had problems at school and at home.

EDIT: inb4 shitstorm rage etc. This is my experience, I don’t care what you have to say(maybe) about it. Whats your experiences like like?

Read full topic

@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Frell:

Seven beats XP by a long shot, but if its just for your family then theres really no need. It wont make a difference in everyday tasks.

Thug-life:

No it doesn’t. Yeah, the UI changes aren’t great, but the actual functionality is always improving. Office is one place where Microsoft always do well.

[quote=“cumescape, post:2, topic:362698”]Stay with XP. There is no reason to upgrade with specs like that.

Also if you do upgrade and use that torrent have fun with your botnet.[/quote]

What the fuck are you talking about. I used a torrented Windows 7 with Haz Windows 7 Activator and I was fully updated. I did this for almost a year and had no problems. Now I am on OSX but I know for sure it would still work.
